column1: Friendly reminder that if you have any doubts the best time to schedule a #COVID19 test is now. Details: https://t.co/rvpzii6X5y

Celebrating #Thanksgiving in the midst of a global pandemic is a new experience for all of us – fortunately @CDCgov has some tips on how you can enjoy your day safely. Have fun be responsible and help us #crushcovid. https://t.co/uHN5Y16QtM https://t.co/6Km05jvUZ5
Looking for a friend to social distance with? @RISPCA may be able to help. This a great time to welcome a pet in need to a loving forever home. https://t.co/m5kFG5c58o

The #COVID19 pandemic has brought much uncertainty to families. Sadly many don’t know where their next meal will come from. I'm committed to tackling food insecurity in Congress because no family should go hungry. https://t.co/KC6tJlxlOz

.@RhodeIslandDEM has established a $1 million fund with #CARESAct funding to help owners of sports facilities recover losses due to recent #COVID19 related closures. Grants of up to $35000 per facility are available. Details: https://t.co/EijcQt52D3

2. The Act creates an alternative #coronavirus relief payment program for farmers based on their historic revenue. It also provides emergency response grants to implement public health protections & coronavirus-smart marketing practices.

1. #COVID19 has hit small farmers particularly hard.  I’m cosponsoring the #LocalFarmerAct to help families put food on the table and enable small/mid-sized farms to cope w/ the impacts of the pandemic.

This afternoon I hosted a briefing from @DeptofDefense on the impact of the #COVID19 pandemic on information & communications technology. We must gather lessons learned from the COVID response to prepare for future threats. https://t.co/7wgnGpMbOP
250000 Americans have lost their lives to #COVID19.  This is not a hoax.  We’re in this together so continue to follow safety guidelines to keep our communities healthy. https://t.co/y9Y7XxBN8J

Testing is key to containing COVID. If you’ve been tested in RI you can use @RIHealth’s new tool which makes it easier to check your results. If you have any doubts remember to quarantine and schedule a test as soon as possible. https://t.co/2N1zfkI4mQ

This is welcome news for the over 3000 #DACA recipients in RI who contribute in so many ways to the fabric of our state – from healthcare workers on the frontlines of #COVID to educators & other essential roles. Their #HomeisHere. https://t.co/dmS8MPfzmt

Another good #COVID vaccine candidate is good news but it does not mean that we can let our guard down.   Until it is widely available every precaution we take will save lives.  https://t.co/VTD0lu7yTV

We are at a critical point in our fight against #COVID19. With cases spiking it's up to each of us to help stop the spread by following public health guidelines:   Mask up. Social distance. Wash your hands.  Quarantine if you feel sick. Get tested.  https://t.co/gaq0nXP5dK
2) Repealing the #ACA would be disastrous for people with preexisting conditions including those experiencing long-term effects from COVID-19.

Rhode Island Hotel Arts & Tourism (HArT) grant funding from @CommerceRI is available for arts & culture organizations confronting the impacts of #COVID19. @risca1967 is hosting a virtual office hour to help folks interested in securing help today at 2pm: https://t.co/zQWXWDyY0o

#COVID19 is a threat to all of US which is why WE ALL must care. Glad to see our young residents leading the charge to raise awareness & prevent further spread during this critical time. https://t.co/qpXB1aOWXU

We must tackle this pandemic together. We can save lives & keep others safe by following health guidelines.   Mask up. Keep your distance. Quarantine if you’re sick. Get tested.   Let's work together to #crushCOVID. https://t.co/YlKjKLlIfz

Trump is clear - he wants the #ACA gone. If it's overturned federal protections for people with pre-existing health conditions – including potential long-term consequences of #COVID19 - would end. We can't allow it.  https://t.co/1b4AQ8vA9u

Drought conditions in RI coupled with the impact of #COVID19 have placed immense pressure on agriculture. I’m pleased to have worked with my Congressional colleagues to ensure local farmers can access relief.  https://t.co/Ih0tHKnvjl

#COVID19 continues to threaten the lives and livelihoods of millions of people yet Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has responded by attempting again to advance a grossly insufficient relief bill that even the President says is too small. https://t.co/qzJUtFziXb https://t.co/abM0uFgrfA

Our state has a proud history of providing quality seafood for our nation but climate change & #COVID19 threaten our fishing industry. We're reintroducing the RI Fishermen’s Fairness Act to ensure they have a seat on @MidAtlanticFish.  https://t.co/l3e3eXV7RT

The City of Providence and @LISCRhodeIsland have partnered to launch a program that offers grants of up to $10000 for microenterprises impacted by #COVID19. Applications will be available beginning Thursday Oct. 29. https://t.co/GBOg3a3t6q

The #COVID19 pandemic is fueling a crisis in housing. Millions of Americans are facing eviction.   It’s important to #KnowYourRights & find out if you qualify for protection from eviction.   For more information visit: https://t.co/MJNFmaw4x5

#COVID19 is the latest in a long line of animal-borne epidemics. We must act now to prevent the next outbreak. I’m working w/@RepMikeQuigley to #PreventFuturePandemics by cracking down on wildlife trade/markets & improving global food systems. https://t.co/cMNhZ4XsJ8

In August I introduced the State & Local IT Modernization & Cybersecurity Act that includes $28B to support system improvements that will enhance security. #COVID19 has made it apparent how much legacy IT is affecting us operationally. We need to act now! https://t.co/gDrqivvMbh
Important info for #smallbiz impacted by the #COVID19 pandemic who are need of help ⏬ https://t.co/tkMr5kUGTB

This is not a time to let up. #COVID continues to be a grave threat to public health. Continue to follow health guidelines - #maskup wash your hands social distance & get tested if you have any doubts. https://t.co/CreGz6E43w

.@HouseDemocrats latest proposal includes $225 billion in support of K-12 schools and colleges and universities to combat the impacts of #COVID19. I urge @senatemajldr to come to the table & work to help our students & educators. https://t.co/X165I0Jpn5

My October newsletter covers the latest on #COVID19 relief negotiations legislation I’m leading to keep transportation projects going in the pandemic & how we took decisive action to confront climate change with the #CleanEconomyJobs and Innovation Act.  https://t.co/QU7ZivyFuM

Families are worried about how to keep roofs over their heads yet the President wants to push a piecemeal approach for #COVID relief that does nothing to help. Lives & livelihoods are on the line & we need a comprehensive response like the #HeroesAct. https://t.co/Lq0uILT17y

.@FEMAgov is providing another opportunity for Volunteer & Combination Fire Departments to apply for funding under the FY2020 Assistance to Firefighters Grant Program. Aid can help secure PPE & other supplies to support COVID-19 preparedness & response. https://t.co/XezIRDjVpE

Families are struggling to cover rent & put food on the table.  Small businesses are struggling to keep their doors open.  States are struggling to recover from the economic downfall.  Meanwhile Trump is walking away from COVID relief negotiations.  https://t.co/acIY66Szss

#COVID19 has taken a significant toll on our world-class food scene. Yesterday I supported the revised #HeroesAct that included the #RESTAURANTSAct to provide $120B in grants to help restaurants & keep 11 million hard-working people employed.  https://t.co/3PjroTkLjU

Wishing President Trump and First Lady Melania Trump a speedy recovery from #COVID19.   No one is immune and that is why it is so important that we all follow safety guidelines from health experts to prevent the spread of this virus.

No age group is immune to #COVID19. Following public health guidelines like wearing a mask is about preventing further spread & saving lives. We all have a role to play in keeping our communities safe.  https://t.co/SbERq003hZ

The threat of #COVID19 remains very real & with flu season approaching @RIHEALTH advises that one of the best ways you can help keep yourself & your family & friends safe is by getting a flu shot.  https://t.co/e7zdjwk6yi

Another day that Mitch McConnell stalls #COVID19 relief by ignoring the #HEROESAct passed 4 months ago. However he has no problem advancing a #SCOTUS nomination that could result in health care being ripped away from millions of Americans. #Unbelievable https://t.co/7TZOmeRfHI

House Dems are working #ForThePeople & have passed 340+ bipartisan bills that are stuck on @senatemajldr's desk. Bills to provide #COVID19 relief lower healthcare costs raise wages clean up corruption & strengthen our democracy are collecting dust on McConnell’s desk. https://t.co/3YSJVnbv0f

.@CommerceRI has made grants of up to $15000 available to help #RI #smallbiz impacted by the #COVID19 pandemic. Almost 900 businesses have received aid and applications for the latest round are now being accepted. https://t.co/lpphcpBg1s

Happy New Year to all who are celebrating #RoshHashanah! Although celebrations will be different this year with virtual and socially distant services I would like to wish our Jewish community a peaceful and fulfilling new year. https://t.co/7j3nUWhavN

I introduced the Highways Coronavirus Relief Act with @davidcicilline & @DustyJohnson to temporarily increase the federal funding share of transportation projects so states can carry on with infrastructure improvements & workers remain employed. https://t.co/cQ7jvK25lL https://t.co/RMNtdQWmS5

1) The #COVID19 pandemic has ravaged state & local budgets. Federal funding will be more important than ever in the coming years particularly to a small state like #RI. The best way to ensure communities receive their fair share is with a complete & accurate #census2020 count. https://t.co/pGjsgayktf

We need a vaccine as soon as possible but we cannot underestimate how effective wearing a face covering is to prevent the spread of #COVID19. Do your part to keep #RI healthy and #maskup. https://t.co/hJheARh4Hu

Better late than never? POTUS is finally urging Republican Senators to take action & provide the American people relief. It’s inexcusable that while #coronavirus infection & death numbers climb they have wanted to shortchange those hit the hardest. https://t.co/SAXNqPhePN

Smoking & vaping weaken lungs & as #COVID19 continues to affect communities nicotine use among young people is especially concerning. @davidcicilline & I underscore in @projo that now is not the time to let up on vaping. https://t.co/2n8j1YIPDm

RI communities are struggling because of the fallout of #coronavirus & I know that this $7.6M in aid through the #CDBG program will make a difference for those hit the hardest. https://t.co/xarvGn18oT
We’re fortunate to have such renowned medical experts as @meganranney helping our state navigate uncharted territory as we deal with the #COVID19 outbreak. https://t.co/BYPt4TwCeb

Today marks 119 days since the House responded to the magnitude of the #coronavirus crisis by passing the #HEROESAct. I joined @SenJackReed @SenWhitehouse & @davidcicilline in urging the Trump Admin to come back to the table & negotiate in earnest to provide relief to millions. https://t.co/OUasqwBWmN

Due to #COVID19 many of our older community members have felt isolated the last few months. I’m thankful for @AgeFriendlyRI’s work to provide a platform for them to connect and learn during this challenging time. #WeAreInThisTogether  https://t.co/AcmnVXZocn

A crisis of this magnitude requires swift action but Senate Republicans have done nothing to help. It is far past time for Congress to pass another relief bill to help hospitals frontline workers states & schools combat #COVID19. https://t.co/chlUEc5QDQ

As the nation with the most #coronavirus deaths the US should be playing a leading role in efforts to overcome the virus. The Trump Admin's decision to not participate in global vaccine research does nothing to bring us closer to a solution.  https://t.co/kJq0uJYcxH

Our non-profit community has stepped up in so many ways to help RIers facing tough decisions b/c of #COVID19. I'm thankful @RIFoundation continues to lend their support to ensure the critical work of these community organizations continues. https://t.co/m9zGIeVqXC

More than 6 million #COVID19 cases was not inevitable. It is the consequence of a President who dismisses medical guidance & GOP Senators under @senatemajldr who've refused to take up the #HeroesAct the House passed 100+ days ago. https://t.co/YS9C02MwiV
Just another friendly reminder to wear your mask to keep you and those around you healthy. #CrushCOVIDRI https://t.co/xc1uRub8N4

Many #RI #smallbiz like @TownofWesterly’s Bridge Restaurant have done an incredible job adjusting to the challenges of #COVID19 but more help is needed. I'm continuing to advocate so Congress delivers more aid for mom-and-pop shops & restaurants. https://t.co/ni9OCVK0NK

Robust testing is key in beating #COVID19. The virus will not simply disappear if we ignore it. Lives are at stake - the President should be working to expand testing not undermining it for political gain. #shameful  https://t.co/5FoqVKChWR

We will beat #COVID19 if we help each other. It’s moving to see orgs like @TeleHealthA4S stepping up to help seniors access technology so they can connect with their families friends & doctors while continuing to social distance. https://t.co/p5Pc9AbNJe

Americans are being squeezed out of their homes because of the #COVID19 outbreak. That's precisely why I advocated for billions in funds in the #HEROESAct to help families with mortgage and #RentReliefNow. @senatemajldr get back to work! https://t.co/fHjledGvSA
Just another friendly reminder that face coverings help keep you and those around you safe and healthy! #Maskup and help us beat #COVID19. https://t.co/SMQjV98qbV

#COVID19 has magnified the serious need to upgrade state & local gov IT & I’m working with a bipartisan group of #cybersecurity leaders to make critical funds available to improve defenses. https://t.co/az0tld0THK

3. #COVID19 has made it apparent how much legacy IT is affecting state & local governments operationally. We need immediate investments to ensure state & local employees can safely work remotely & we need IT modernization strategies to ensure essential services can be provided.

Over 5 million Americans have contracted #COVID19 & millions have lost their jobs. Yet POTUS has chosen to threaten #SocialSecurity & #Medicare. Weakening & dismantling safety nets for the most vulnerable won't help us recover. https://t.co/7pnu1N68sT
ICYMI: Face coverings work against #COVID19! #Maskup and help keep those around you safe! https://t.co/o5SX9a2alH

Health experts like Dr. @meganranney have been instrumental in our fight to keep RIers safe from #COVID19. To beat the virus the Trump Administration has to heed the guidance of public health professionals. https://t.co/yf3OjrJkCj

#COVID19 has put pressure on service members with approximately 1.2M children under age 13 in military families requiring child care due to school closures. I've joined @RepMichaelWaltz in a bipartisan letter asking @DeptofDefense for more options for them https://t.co/brCaiy8VdJ
The deadline for small businesses & organizations to apply for COVID-19 relief from @SBAGov’s Paycheck Protection Program is TODAY. You can find everything you need to apply: https://t.co/lf7sIr6YCP

Small businesses and non-profits reeling from #COVID19 still have some time to apply for help from the @SBAGov’s Paycheck Protection Program. The #PPP deadline is tomorrow August 8. For more info & to apply: https://t.co/lf7sIr6YCP

In my recent newsletter I cover: ▶️@senatemajldr stalling the next #coronavirus relief package ▶️Legislation to address the #COVID child care crisis  ▶️How government funding bills passed by the House will help protect our nation & uplift communities   https://t.co/i8cCQV8Xba
Americans should not be going hungry. To fight food insecurity future #COVID19 relief must increase #SNAP benefits and continue pandemic #EBT. https://t.co/raiap4lGbn
We’ve done a great job in containing #COVID19 here in RI but this is not a time to let our guard down. Continue to follow health safety tips like those provided by @RIHEALTH. https://t.co/f3ukK4NO4g

Not all families were able to tap into relief from past #COVID19 relief legislation & that's why I'm working to ensure future aid reaches more of our vulnerable community members. In the meantime spread the word about the weR1 RI Relief Fund. https://t.co/1qMxdeeKqa

GOP Senators' latest #COVID19 relief proposal does nothing to help states & cities facing fiscal crunches essentially dismissing the needs of heroes like firefighters & teachers on the front lines. America won't recover if we leave them behind.  https://t.co/YcIg8xeurN

ICYMI: This morning I spoke to @GeneValicenti on @wpro about our latest efforts to provide Americans additional #COVID19 relief my bipartisan push to strengthen cybersecurity & wins for #RI in legislation I've helped pass.  https://t.co/LuY8UPk3hR

.@CommerceRI’s #RestoreRI application portal for small business #COVID19 relief grants of up $15000 is now open. I'm proud federal #CARESAct funding helped launch this initiative.  https://t.co/vupXDNkqql

The arts are helping communities across RI unite & heal. Kudos to @RILatinoArts which recently helped turn sidewalks in Providence into beautiful canvases & raised awareness of #COVID19 prevention measures. https://t.co/DVimLlm7lA

I'm joining @GeneValicenti on @wpro at 8:35am to discuss the latest on the next #COVID19 relief package + other legislation we've passed in recent weeks to appropriate funds & help families set our national defense priorities & improve #cybersecurity. https://t.co/ow29nXjtNE

GOP Senators claim enhanced unemployment disincentivizes working but that's not been true during #COVID. Helping ppl put food on the table & keep a roof over their heads during a pandemic that's claimed 155K+ lives in the US shouldn’t be a divisive issue. https://t.co/g3SgDUolQU

I agree with @JudgeCaprio and @RIHEALTH - be cautious and do your part to keep fellow RIers safe. Wear a mask social distance wash hands often & you'll help us #CrushCOVIDRI! #MaskupRI https://t.co/0RE9qTvmuW

Small businesses can begin submitting applications for aid from the #RestoreRI Grant Program made possible with #CARESAct #COVID19 relief funding on Monday August 3. It’s on a first come first served basis. For more details visit: https://t.co/lpphcpjECS

I'm cosponsoring the #RESTAURANTSAct b/c it includes $120B in relief for an industry that cannot be forgotten. #RI is home to incredible establishments & hardworking people - future #COVID relief legislation must help them keep their doors open. https://t.co/GPHBnBxZfw

It's been 55 years since #Medicare & #Medicaid were enacted. Today the need for access to quality affordable health care is even more urgent because of #COVID19. We must continue to fight to preserve & strengthen these important programs.

2. It's no coincidence POTUS is tweeting this proposition this morning. He’s trying to distract from reports showing our economy has experienced a historic plunge. Time to work on passing the next #COVID relief package not undermining faith in elections. https://t.co/ETfrJdkNNS

1) As we take measured steps to reopen families need access to safe & affordable child care so parents & guardians can return to work. The #COVID19 pandemic created massive disruptions in the child care sector & we need to #SaveChildCare.  https://t.co/JdDbbV4DZK https://t.co/3DqUrgUjpg

The emergence of COVID #telework has shown us that technology can keep us connected even in trying times. But we can’t forget about security. With more workers & businesses relying on remote access #cybersecurity can’t be an afterthought.  https://t.co/VqoftOGKNu

Even in the darkest of times the arts have a special way of lighting up lives with comfort and hope. Thank you to @WaterFireProv for this touching tribute for lives tragically lost to #COVID19. https://t.co/6V37M1y51q

More than 1000 Rhode Islanders have lost their lives to COVID-19 a sobering reminder that the fight to overcome this pandemic isn’t over. For everyone’s safety please continue to wear a mask frequently wash your hands & social distance.

For our state to recover from this health crisis #RI hospitals need to continue receiving resources to provide quality care. I was pleased to announce $71M in #CARESAct funding to our help hospitals continue their invaluable work against #COVID19.  https://t.co/SZk0Jhc2U2

Reminder: Testing is key to beating #COVID19! In Rhode Island @RIHEALTH has been making it easier. A variety of options to #gettested are now offered including this new drive-thru site in downtown Providence. https://t.co/4yCZ0GqciF

The #HeroesAct the House passed 2+months ago provides $100B to help schools mitigate the impact of #coronavirus & reopen safely. The bill is sitting on @senatemajldr’s desk collecting dust. The Senate should pass it & the President should sign it into law https://t.co/vqyGT9YYlf

140K+ Americans have lost their lives to #COVID19 & numerous new infections are reported daily. By no means are we over this. There's no legitimate reason to block $ for testing when it's the best way to monitor & prevent the spread of this terrible virus https://t.co/8z4HOjrHHX

The President has made it clear he would prefer to suppress testing/reporting of #COVID19 yet it’s still shocking to see the Administration following through with his absurd wishes. https://t.co/G2yzjrfAmR

As you read this think of all the ways you use the device you’re on. #Cybersecurity affects so many aspects of our lives even more now w/ #COVID19. An expert should be advising the President as #NationalCyberDirector & developing policies to safeguard us https://t.co/DLiDfWX6S5

1) In recent days influential Twitter accounts were breached & @CISAgov announced Russian cyber actors are targeting US #COVID19 vaccine research. I’m chairing a @homelanddems hearing shortly on why #cybersecurity must be top of mind: https://t.co/kI07O4U3KA

ICYMI: @GovRaimondo has announced $100M in relief funding to help #RI #smallbiz with a good portion from #CARESAct #coronavirus aid. The application period has not opened yet but general info is now available at: https://t.co/lpphcpBg1s

.@senatemajldr's timeline for additional #coronavirus relief is a disservice to Americans who've lost jobs and will cause a lapse in needed aid. On average 1 in 5 workers on unemployment will see their weekly income drop by 60% just as bills are due. https://t.co/Eq11TgVQXr

A healthcare crisis forcing life-or-death decisions has come with #COVID19. Yet the President continues attempts to gut the #ACA. To expand access to coverage the House recently passed the Patient Protection & Affordable Care Enhancement Act. https://t.co/yffrWhSJOU

Happy 100th birthday to Lilian Levasser a true fighter and great source of inspiration for fellow Rhode Islanders. She has overcome COVID-19 and is now sharing her message of hope and perseverance! https://t.co/XnTKq0aQnd

.@SenJackReed @SenWhitehouse @DavidCicilline & I announced $128K to @thundermisthc for #telehealth services. The disproportionate impact of #COVID19 on vulnerable communities underscores the need for expanded access to quality healthcare.  https://t.co/svedGjpD4v

International students at U.S. colleges & universities make important contributions to this country. #COVID19 shouldn't limit them from continuing their studies. If we want to maintain our edge we need to continue to attract & develop the brightest talent https://t.co/XFXOhQz8XI

Over 3 million in the U.S. have been infected more than 130K have died & we've set a new single day record of 60K cases. The fight against #coronavirus is far from over. Withdrawing from the @WHO at this critical time is irresponsible & dangerous https://t.co/Yvq7q4jSbO

Over 200K #DACA recipients are helping to fight #COVID19 on the front lines in essential roles ranging from healthcare to education & food production/distribution. It's unconscionable that POTUS continues his efforts to end the program & upend their lives. https://t.co/Lfkl2qIENs

With more people working from home the attack surface for has become much larger. The #COVID19 outbreak has placed an emphasis on the need for a forward-leaning national #cybersecurity strategy that incorporates recommendations from @CyberSolarium. https://t.co/0ZY1J4fmCt

Over the weekend legislation was signed into law extending the Paycheck Protection Program until August 8. #PPP has helped businesses impacted by #COVID19 stay open & kept workers on the payroll. You may qualify for help; find an eligible lender in #RI: https://t.co/FO2QvrPN8M

This weekend keep in mind that to slow the spread of #COVID19 we all us must take personal responsibility to protect ourselves & the people around us. By taking simple action we can keep RIers healthy. @CDCgov offers safety tips: https://t.co/DD8htByu5G https://t.co/Y5RAYNjFYQ

It's certainly great news that #RI is leading the way in the fight against the #coronavirus but we have to keep in mind that we did this by looking out for one another. Be safe & we’ll continue to #CrushCovidRI  https://t.co/rKVXrHNcHj

Announced $8M+ in federal funding to enhance emergency preparedness in #RI w/ @SenJackReed @SenWhitehouse & @davidcicilline. #COVID19 has made it clear we must be prepared to face the most challenging emergencies. This critical funding will help us. https://t.co/293EWM2jC7

Research conducted by @DARPA & other @DeptofDefense labs gave us a head start in #coronavirus treatments & vaccines. In the #FY21NDAA I’ve called for a broader research strategy on emerging threats biological threats & how we incorporate our preparations into planning exercises

#COVID19 evolved naturally but what if the next pandemic threat is human-made? The #FY21NDAA will require a plan on how we can better prepare and mitigate against state-sponsored chemical and biological attacks.
As a reminder @IRSnews has extended the tax filing deadline to July 15 due to #COVID19. If you need additional time you can request an extension. https://t.co/CO3RPoEKja

RI begins Phase III of reopening today - we are making progress! But the risk remains and we must continue to be cautious. Wear a mask - do your part to help prevent the spread. #CrushCovidRI. https://t.co/c90Ei41bYi

125K+ Americans have lost their lives to #COVID19 & highlighted the need for affordable health coverage. Today I voted for the Patient Protection & Affordable Care Enhancement Act to boost #ACA subsidies expand Medicare & lower prices of prescription drugs. #LowerCostsForCare

The deadline for Paycheck Protection Program loan applications is tomorrow June 30. If your business has been impacted by #COVID19 you may be able to get help. Find a qualified lender: https://t.co/FO2QvrPN8M

The #COVID19 pandemic has underscored the need to defend & strengthen the Affordable Care Act. I support the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Enhancement Act b/c it will lower health costs & prescription drug prices at a time when it is badly needed. https://t.co/26MyXFPDdF

Wearing a face covering is an effective way to prevent the spread of bacteria and viruses like #coronavirus. Great visual demonstration on @TODAYshow of how masks can stop the spread of germs and help keep you and the people around you safe. #CrushcovidRI https://t.co/jYH0YwTeLX

If you have any doubt get tested for #COVID19. @RIHEALTH has compiled resources for symptomatic & asymptomatic testing taking place across the state. The best way to prevent spread is to be safe and aware.  https://t.co/rvpzii6X5y

#COVID19 has not passed - we must be cautious. A vaccine will pave the way forward. I'm thankful for experts like Dr. @meganranney who are on the front lines conducting vital medical research. https://t.co/8aFLltfERW

#Cybersecurity affects everything around us. #COVID19 has shown us we need to take steps like establishing a National Cyber Director to reduce risks & prevent hackers from disrupting how we do businesses operate government & even connect on social media https://t.co/BLTbLSEyPV

#DACA recipients are community leaders parents friends business owners & #Heroes on the front lines of #COVID19. With an impending Supreme Court ruling my message remains the same: your home is here and I have your back. https://t.co/U6APkxruGV

.@liveunitedri knows that we are stronger together. They're offering much-needed financial help to keep nonprofits going through the RI Recovers program. If you've been impacted by #COVID19 the deadline for proposals is Wednesday June 17. https://t.co/JOtrciBcjY

More testing will allow more Rhode Islanders to help prevent spread of #coronavirus. Pre-symptomatic spread continues to be a serious concern. I’m thankful that testing will now serve those not displaying symptoms.  https://t.co/QZmsu2qzlk

I agree. Making sure our states recover from the economic downturn created by #COVID19 and bolster our national economy is in the best interest of all Americans. It’s time for @senatemajldr to take action and pass the #HEROESAct. https://t.co/BrIbPHg7mq

I’m proud that the nation’s first offshore Wind Farm is in #RI’s 2nd Congressional district. Clean energy is a game changer that creates jobs & helps preserve our planet. As our economy recovers from COVID-19 future legislation should support a robust clean energy workforce. https://t.co/2fVLKXqeWN

Inspiring story from @bamaral44 about one of our very own local heroes Dr. @aakritipandita who is working to combat #COVID19 & keep RIers safe after battling & overcoming the virus herself. https://t.co/YBGP37hYWi

COVID-19 has placed a spotlight on #cybersecurity issues as more people work remotely threat actors target digital services & fraudsters commit opportunistic cybercrime. @CyberSolarium’s new 'pannex' lays out how our report relates to the pandemic. https://t.co/JVXGAUt6GI
